Reviews.Title: “Boutique feel”
Reviews.Author: JeaneAOD
Reviews.Content: The porta Marina is situated in an industrial district in Barcelona, it’s not an area for restaurants or shopping, but it is within close proximity of the Metro so traveling into central Barcelona and the sights isn’t a problem. It’s a modern hotel with a ‘Boutique’ feel. The room was large and split into two areas, bedroom with en suite and a lovely large sitting / dining area. It was very clean. Breakfast was not included but there is a breakfast area. Not the best continental selection I have had, but definitely not the worst. Pluses: Location to the metro. Spacious. Room service menu. Minus’: Staff were young and not happy / friendly / overly helpful. The room smelt of stale smoke, even opening the windows for hours didn’t get rid of it. If you require a double bed you have to ask for one as otherwise you will get twin beds. Even couples checking in will automatically be assigned twins. A room for two apparently means that in this hotel! There was a kitchenette in the room but unless you are staying for one month or over you dud not get any crockery, tea making facilities etc.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and tidy, but not the best area.”
Reviews.Author: V0yager
Reviews.Content: A good modern hotel with large rooms. Clean and tidy. Staff friendly and efficient. Only negatives are the area - you are next to the city crematorium and have the pleasure of passing a funeral causage most mornings! The beds are alo not that great- thin mattresses and a bit small. Other than that is a fair choice.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't sleep whole night”
Reviews.Author: melbcollege
Reviews.Content: I stayed only one night at Apsis Porta Marina hotel but I had the worst hotel sleep experience. hotel located in a suburb close to Auditor and National theatre Barcelona. I arrived on good friday, it was so quiet and in fact the whole suburb was died. Hardly see anyone and nothing open around here. Staff are okey, did their job. Room is fine, nothing special. However I discovered the sink at bathroom is not working properly, I called reception and staff did offer me change to another room, but i just cant be bothered as I only stay for one night. The worst part of this stay is during the night, my goodness, I could not believe how much noise these cars can make. hotel is not far from the highway, seem whole night was in rush hour. I have no idea how many pubs and bars around here, but so many people screaming, laughing and drinking away. I wake up around 1 am and could not go back to sleep at all whole night. Maybe it is only one night for public holiday. But I will not come back to this area again in any cost.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Apsis Porta Marina”
Reviews.Author: Vicky D
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated close to Marina metro and from there it is 3-4 stops into the heart of the city. We were within walking distance of the beaches and la Ribera. The rooms are very clean, modern & spacious although a bit sterile. The helpful front staff called a local jazz club for us to get the low down on hours and tickets. We bought some breakfast foods at a small grocery store around the corner- be sure to save your plastic utensils from your flight as there are none in the room. It is possible to order coffee from the restaurant, reasonably priced. We also rode the green line tour bus and caught it at the nearby National Theater. This, by the way, is a great way to get an overview of the city as well as getting to Sagra Familia & Parc Guell.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to the very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: pread26
Reviews.Content: We had been recommended this hotel as part of our Airmiles / Avios booking and having done so twice before were happy to take their steer. Again, we have left very happy with our experience although we did wonder at first. On arrival the smell in the room from the bathroom was awful and got worse. Then, after the hot water was not running, we spoke with the front desk, The willingness of the staff to sort our problems cannot be faulted. Within a short period the water problem had been resolved and we had been moved to a new larger room without problem. We couldn't have asked for better service. I would say that if you take the time to read reviews on this site and take them as a broad average then that is pretty much what you get. For us we found the place to be clean, the rooms are large and well equiped and a strong wifi signal exists throughout. The staff, as said, are very helpful and have a good command of English. The lack of tea / coffee in the room was a minor irritant and one that they could easily resolve if desired. The lockers for storing bags on your final day is a nice touch. There is much talk on the site about location. Yes it is near the local funeral home and supporting businesses that surround it. That said, as you are rarely there we did not find this an issue. You are a short walk from the metro / tram stops and 10 min walk from Familia Sagrada and the Citidelia park so that was great. There isnt much around the hotel so you will need to ventrue out in the evening but the place felt safe. We had no experience of the noise some reviews refer to although being a very cold Feb this might be why. The neighbouring Melon Cafe is bob on for breakfast or a quick snack. All in all we left happy travellers and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Apsis Porta Marina - Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Cork2004
Reviews.Content: A great hotel for a family of four. It had fine spacious rooms. Only fault - ig had a kitchen but had no utensils which really meant it wasn't of much use to use i.e. no cups! We had requested a kettle which we got but no cups were there. Staff were lovely. There was fine wifi. Near the metro. Clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: wing2799
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel prior to a cruise. This was a great hotel. The room was very large and very clean. The same goes for the bathroom. We had a " matrimonial" bed (by request) and it was large and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and spoke adequate english. We needed a van to take 8 of us to the cruise terminal and they set it up for a very reasonable rate. It was also about a 20 minute walk to the marina and numerous restaurants and a 25 minute walk to the Las Ramblas area and other sights. we felt safe where ever we walked. However, if you turn right out of the hotel the area isn't so good. The hotel offers special discount tickets to the double decker tour buses which is the only way to see Barcelona. You can get on and off as much as you want and change to the other line/route (there are 2 ). The breakfast at the hotel is good but a little pricey however there is a little cafe on the corner which is very good and reasonable. We would stay there again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: BostonUSTraveller
Reviews.Content: Small, clean confortable hotel. Only about a mile walk to the sea. Free wifi was a plus. Hotel breakfast (14 euros) was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: chrissiJO
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid for this hotel and the flights i think it was pretty good value for money.the room was lovely,very modern and clean,only 2 things would've made stay more comfortable...tea and coffee making facilities in room and there was a problem with our door lock ie we didnt realise the card system wasnt actually working to lock our door until our 3rd day when i pushed handlke down and the door just opened!Luckily valubles were still in tact,hotel staff very apologetic and helpful though especially when i realised i'd forgotton to confirm our transfer back to the airport and the guy on reception was very helpful and sorted it all out for me.They all speak excellent english!breakfast in hotel rather pricey but the melon cafe next door very reasonable,around 10 euros for the 3 of us for drinks and croissants.3 females travelling alone,at no point did i feel nervous,very safe and central location for metro and Sagrada Familia within about 10 mins walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Avarage hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cristopher
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near a metro station and with in walking distance from Sagrada Familia. The room was nice but not very clean. In the bathroom there wasn't a toilet brush. the staff in the reception was helpful but don't ask them to call a taxi for you. The taxi we got to the airport over charged us with 12 euro (the trip from airport-hotel was 30 euro and the trip hotel-airport was 42 euro).

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the noise!”
Reviews.Author: Liverbird50186337
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 6 nights. Lets start with the good things, which are many. Immaculately clean, towels and bedding changed everyday. Staff friendly. Breakfast very filling, we even took an apple each for our 2pm snack and didnt need to eat a meal til 5pm.Storage for cases on last day was a boom as we had a late flight home, we could explore more of the delightful Barcelona. Computer access and free WIFI. Location is excellent, we used the marina and bogatel metro lines and the tram. We got 5 day travel cards and you can do as many journey's as you want. Did get a taxi to hotel in first night and that was reasonable. The 'melon' cafe next door was great for our evening cup of tea, a must for us English. I would like to suggest to the hotel they follow the example of all English accomodation and provide a small tray with kettle and coffee tea making facilities on in each room or a hot drink machine in the reception area. Now onto the reason for my title, SADLY our first 4 nights in rm 201 (don't stay in it) we hardly slept. We assumed the first night was a one off for the noisy groups passing the hotel but i had to ring reception at 4am on Saturday as a group had congregated right underneath our very badly fitted windows for 2 hours shouting and talking. Thank goodness for rain Sun and Mon evenings. it was quieter. We live on a busy main road so I am used to traffic noise but not screaming and shouting. Saturday it went on til 7.30am. I would love to recommend this hotel as so much about it was excellent, but 4 nights disturbed sleep (thank god for earplugs) makes it difficult too recommend it. Only way i would jump at another stay is if i could be re-assured of quiet nights. Both of us will definately visit BARCA again as its the most amazing place we have been too but staying at APSIS I am not sure sadly.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for city break”
Reviews.Author: lovesunshine85
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel in great location, 5 minute walk from metro station and just 3 stops on the red line to Placa de Catalunya. Staff all seemed friendly and check in / out was quick and efficient. Rooms were spacious but I agree they could of been cleaned a little better. Our room didn't have the kitchen but the fridge was a good edition. Would stay again and would reccomend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, not very clean”
Reviews.Author: Fabienne829
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location and spacious, airy rooms. We had a triple room and we were surprised of how big and well-furnished our room was. But we had only one complaint it's the cleanliness. During our 5 days stay nor the towels or the sheets were replaced with fresh one. I wouldn't stay there the next time...

Reviews.Title: “surprise at apsis porta.”
Reviews.Author: mikeWalesU_k_
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel due to a complete mess up by our travel company Ideal Cruising.Not an imposing building from the outside.Check in was effortless.Very nice room,equipped with microwave,two t.v.,s lounge ,kitchenette,bathroom,fridge.Nice toiletries in bathroom,great buffet breakfast.Staff first rate.Wish we had more time to spend there,

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Liina1302
Reviews.Content: Modern 4-stars hotel which is situated walking distance from many places - BarcelonaZOO, Aquarium, Barceloneta, Ciutadel, Torre Akbar, beach etc. Different places to have breakfast or dinner are very close to hotel. We stayed in family room no. 414 and there were enough space for two children and two adults (one bedroom + living room). WiFi in the room work very good, no any problem. Very friendly and helpful staff at reception. There were no noise or any disturbance in the night during our stay. Only bad thing was that we did not have a kettle in the room and everywhere were cleaning lady´s hair (long and dark), it disturbs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: fbandig100
Reviews.Content: good clean spacious rooms. 15 mins walk from centre of Barcelona so therefore peaceful as centre of town was very noisy. 15 mins to beach. Excellent staff. Very helpful. Coffee was good. No tea or coffee making facilities in room. bed was huge. Shower good. No shampoo but shower gel. Toothbrushes & toothpaste provided. Free map of city given on arrival. We had a late flight so they looked after our luggage at no extra cost. didn.t try breakfast but plenty of bars on walk into centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: AASRFB
Reviews.Content: Very confortable hotel with excelent conditions for families. (spacious, separate rooms, 2 TVS, etc) Although it is not in the centre of Barcelona you are 5€ to 7€ by taxy (being a family of four it is cheaper than getting by subway). On the other end you are closer to Port Olimpic and the beach. You can walk from the hotel (about 15 min. walk) Very spacious rooms, modern decoration and very functional. The kitchen doesn't have kitchenware but you can manage with a couple of paper plates and cups for breakfast. Just next to the hotel youl will find "Melon District" witch is a youth modern residence with a really nice self-service restaurant for breakast and meals at affordable prices. It also sells milk, water, cookies, etc witch isconvienient to take to the room (especially if you are travelling with children). You can get free wi-fi in the rooms and common areas. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: ralali
Reviews.Content: Large rooms. Very modern. Friendly staff. Five minute walk from a metro stop. Three metro stops from Catalunya sq (city's major attraction). Fifteen min walking distance from Port Olympic: a great sport for dinner by the sea, Casino, and many choices of night entertainment. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well Appointed and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: lavajelly01494
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights as a family of two adults and 2 children (11 & 9) in a family room. Was a bit apprehensive as the location was out of the main area however we needed safe parking and somewhere that was not too expensive for the 4 of us. Although the location is a bit out of the main area the hotel is close to the tram line which takes you to the Port Marina which has loads of restaurants and a the beach. To get into the main hub is a quick ride of 2 to 3 stops on the efficient and clean underground train and the underground station is close to the hotel. We took a taxi from the Marina after dinner and it was £5. I have stayed in hotels near the Ramblas which cost more and were not as well appointed and will now rather stay at the Apsis for the cost saving. The family room has one double bed in the main room and a double fold out sofa in the lounge. It did have a kitchen but is unequipped for short stays. A kettle for tea and coffee making would be a nice touch though. There is a microwave and looks like it would work to warm up baby bottles or meals. An under counter fridge is provided which was handy for drinks. Good bathroom with a large shower although the shower head had a mind of its own when the pressure was turned up high. Secure underground parking was £15 a night. Breakfast was adequate with a decent choice. Free Wi-Fi provided. All in all a good hotel that I would recommend for a family stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you want quiet”
Reviews.Author: catllar
Reviews.Content: Quiet and peaceful. Great room, pleasant multilingual staff. Proper kingsize bed with comfy mattress. Enormous shower. Has paying underground parking which is a bit pricey but secure. Not in centre but no problems to get about. Very safe area even at night. Taxis available less than 50 metres away. Less than 5mins walk to Marina subway and city centre Catalunya or Barcelonetta is only about 10 mins journey. Good bar for breakfast by subway. Coffee and croissant for 2.50€. I'll be going back here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gonzaloque
Reviews.Content: We sayed three nights at this hotel and enjoyed it. Very clean, spacious room and huge bathroom with super water pressure in shower. The location is not central to tourist attractions but you are blocks away from two metro stations that connect you to the entire city. The beach is about a 15 minute walk or 6 minute metro ride away. Breakfast buffet was included in our rate and was good. Wifi service is very good and once you connect in the room you can roam around the entire building and remain connected.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, good price”
Reviews.Author: holidaysmilesfor5
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at the end of April 2011. We are a family of 5 (2 adults and 3 kids aged 12yrs, 12 yrs and 3yrs) but we also had with my mother with us (6 of us in total). We had booked a family room which could only accommodate the 5 of us if my youngest son stayed in a cot which they provided free of charge. Instead, we ended up declining the cot and one of my older sons slept in my mothers room, however there would have been enough room in the family room to easily accommodate a cot. The family room was brilliant for us because we could put my youngest to bed in the bedroom and not have to turn out all the lights and sit quietly in the dark! The living room had a double sofa bed, (unequipped) kitchenette and a breakfast table. As we only stayed for 2 nights, we only needed a fridge so the fact that there were no utensils in the kitchen didn't matter. The bathroom was very modern and clean. The only problem we had was that there was only 1 TV which was in the bedroom so when my son went to sleep, we couldn't watch anything - again not a big problem for us. Although, there was a definite space in the family room for a TV so perhaps it was being repaired. The free WIFI was excellent and the best WIFI connection that we had during our whole 6 week stay in Europe. The breakfast was great although probably expensive, but with 3 hungry kids to feed each morning, it was an easy option. They provided a couple of cereal choices (cornflakes and museli), cold sliced meats and cheeses, eggs and sausages and toast/bread. The staff were all brilliant and extremely helpful. They all spoke English very well and we had no difficulty communicating with them. The location was OK, but certainly not in the heart of everything. We comfortably walked to the large shopping centre (Glories) and we also walked to the Casino (beachfront) from where we caught the red Hop On, Hop Off bus. The only downside of the Hotel was the lack of a restaurant for dinner and the poor quality of room service food. We are not fussy eaters at all and the few things we had were just not good. Overall though, this motel is a good choice in terms of a modern, clean and friendly place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: AdiBrasov
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel (it was open few years ago) . Big and clean Rooms. Free WiFi in all rooms. Not the best location but close to Metro (Marin and Bogatel) and City Center. (~15 min walking distance to Sagrada Familia or gothic town )

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but...”
Reviews.Author: Vaasha
Reviews.Content: In general its a good hotel however the location is not too great. The neighbourhood seems to be some kind of artistic underground scene with a rock club around the corner which attracts this kind of guys. I didnt feel very secure returning to the hotel in the night. Its close to red metro line L1. On the way you will be meet funeral services and crematory. One thing I didnt like is that we got a small room oriented to a noisy multi-lane street. I think its because we got the room for a sale price. I dont think its fair to do so. If they dont like budget travellers they shouldnt be offering a sale in first place instead of 'rewarding' them with a worse room. You can even walk to this hotel if you exit the airport train in station Clot. The beach Nova Icaria is also not too far so you can walk there. That is why I chose this location and in general it wasnt a bad choice for 80 Euro per night for a small double room. The cleanness is what it should be in a 4* hotel. Also the staff looked friendly and ready to help. Wifi you get for free.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel although directed more towards business customers”
Reviews.Author: Dragonfly87
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in May and overall it was a very nice hotel. The rooms were large and very modern and the bathroom a good size too. Although we didnt have a kitchen in our room, as mentioned in other reviews, there was a small table and fridge. There were a few basic items found in most hotels which I was surprised to find missing, such as a clock, note pad and pen, however these were not important so havent influenced my review. The location was good enough for the price we paid with the nearest tube station being only a 5 minute walk away, however I would say the surrounding area was mainly business rather than sight seeing and if you prefer a bit of a nightlife I wouldnt recommend this hotel. The Apsis Porta Marina is a good base for seeing the city and with a good tube network your never to far from anything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean, good location and friendly english speaking staff!”
Reviews.Author: hpatra
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before and after our Disney Mediterranean Cruise. The best part was its location, it is about 5 minutes walk from the Marina metro and tram stations. It is 2 stations away from the most happening place in Barcelona: La Rambla. Though we did not walk to the Rambla because we had kids, I think it will be a 15 minutes walk to the Ramblas. We took the family room and it is like a studio suite. The bed room is separated from the drawing/kitchen by a wall. The kitchenette has a microwave, stove and a mini fridge. But there were no utensils, I think they provide utensils for long-term stays. We didn't opt for their breakfast as there were many cafes on the way to the metro station. They have free wi-fi for guests and I liked the speed though the signal strength was not good at some spots in the room. The staff were excellent, all of them speak English and always answered my questions/doubts with a smile. Only negative thing if I have to point out is the quality of the bed, the beds could be made more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, bright and big rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_on_tour09
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Barcelona. We wanted to stay away from the usual tourist haunts and this hotel was perfect. Its only a 10min max (safe) walk from the bus station and 10min to Arc de Triomph. To be honest there werent any good local resturants, but the walk through the park to the born area is worthwhile. We felt safe the entire time. The rooms were ENORMOUS by european standards, contemporary and extremely clean. The hotel staff were lovely. Free internet in the lobby. Really really great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: JaaCee
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a short city break. Although it's situated in more of an industrial/business area, it's extremely handy for the metro, tram and a taxi rank is also very close by. Walking distance to Teatro Nacional, Sagrada Familia and Torre Agbar. Rooms are spotless, spacious and very comfy. When I go back to Barcelona I will definitely stay at this hotel. I do recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Itamarl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located out of the center, but 3 minutes walk from the metro station which will bring you to Placa Catalunya in 5 minutes, so actually you're 10 minutes from the heart of the city. There is a small supermarket next to the station, which is always very convenient. The rooms are big and comfortable, with both two armchairs, a table and two chairs. The lighting is well, the bathroom is big and well equiped. The roon tnd public areas are clean. As we keep Kosher, breakfast wasn't a big catch for us. A tip for Kosher keepers and vegetarians: there are fat-free whale grain rolls, just ask which are they. Strangely, they keep the salt and pepper in the drawer, so you'll have to ask for them as well. A very big advantage: the whole hotel is wi-fi area and you use it for free even in your room. There is also a printer in the lobby. Book the hotel in its own web site ang get the best price. By the whole, it was a great deal, and we enjoyed the hotel a lot.

Reviews.Title: “The neat and clean hotel near all possible main attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Barakuri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Porta Marina Hotel at November 2010 with my wife on our leisure trip to Barcelona. I'd liked my room from the first sight, and after our stay here it has been satisfied. Room was spacious and white-clean with large windows, that were situated in style of "corner office" in our case. With view on l'Auditori, National Theater of Catalunya, Sagrada Familia, Torre Agbar and many more... An accessibility of all main tourist attractions was completely out of a problem. 5 minutes of lazy walk to nearest Metro and Tram station, 2 minutes to Bus stop. Personal on the reception was always friendly and helpful, despite mild language difficulties at time. Free Wi Fi throughout the whole compound [no strings attached]. About drawbacks: pillows were small and "low-volume" [I would recommend to ask reception for an exchange], the cleaning in certain areas [under the bed] wasn't perfect, well-described problem of the wet floor near the shower still "alive" [however wasn't problem for us at all], and breakfast ... I would call this - "somewhat boring"... Although appropriate for price... Bottom line: Hotel completely worth of your money and consideration, and suitable for families or business partners.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room, very comfortable, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: mlindop
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in three hotels this trip, Barcelona, Berlin and Paris, this hotel was by far the most comfortable and spacious for roughly the same price. Huge room with a living area including a table and chairs, as well as a two comfy chairs and a large very comfortable bed. The room had a fridge and the large bathroom had a bath and the most powerful shower I have ever used. The blackout curtains would have been fantastic had they been 3" wider, but still better than most hotels. Good free WiFi connection Only 5 mins from the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the good advice”
Reviews.Author: matildathecat
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay here after reading the reviews on this website and was very pleased with the choice. Although the hotel is not centrally located, it is well placed for metro, tram stops and is easy walking distance to the beach, Glories and Sagrada Familia. Other reviewers commented on the smell of the drains. This was not a problem for us. Although we smelt this all over Barcelona, particularly near to the coast, the hotel smelled fragrant, so either they have sorted it out, or maybe it is only a problem after heavy rain?? The room was fantastic. It had a separate bedroom and lounge/kitchen-diner. As we only stayed 3 nights, the kitchen was no use and it was a little odd that there was no kettle, but we did make good use of the sofa and TVs with BBC World and CNN. Although the bedroom had 2 twin beds, these were easy to push together and were very comfortable. The curtains were thick and we had no problems with thin walls or noise, so we slept very well. The rooms have climate control air con which was useful as it got a bit chilly in the evening (October). Unfortunately the beds had no quilts, just some of those blankets to put over the sheets, but these did the job. I found the staff to speak adequate English and they were helpful. I would recommend the breakfasts. There is a good choice and it is replenished frequently; though I would not recommend the scrambled egg (!) The hotel had guests of different nationalities, both for business and leisure; couples, families and individual travellers and it had a nice atmosphere. The hotel has free wi-fi in the rooms and communal areas, though it is quite slow in certain places. There is a sundeck (access from Floor 6). In October, although we were lucky to have lovely sunshine and it was very warm, (by UK standards - about 21 degrees celsius), the low aspect of the sun meant that this only received sunshine for a few hours of the day.... but then we didn't go to Barcelona to get a tan! I only gave the hotel 4/5 for service because I felt that there was a lack of information on the local area for the guests, such as how to get to the nearest metro and nearby bars and restaurants. We had to ask the reception, who were sometimes busy or there were difficulties with communication. On our final day, we had a late flight . The hotel offered to look after our bags so we could make the most of our limited time in the city. I would definitely stay again at the Apsis Porta Marina and would recommend it to anyone wanting a nice hotel that is a good base to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “thin walls but good prices”
Reviews.Author: markymark999
Reviews.Content: stayed here mid september. The hotel wasnt too busy and i would agree with other reviews. The location is good for the tram and underground from Marina. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. If i had one criticism, it would be the that walls are a bit thin. There was only one or two nights when we could hear next door but if we had been unlucky with a noisy next door neighbor we would definitely had trouble sleeping. The rooms are big and as described on the hotel website. They dont provide a kettle unless your a long-stay customer. Travel to/from hotel to airport is €34 approx

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms.....”
Reviews.Author: nvar
Reviews.Content: Hotel was located in a quiet area away from the noise, but its suitated literally not far from the beach, tram and metro and 2 minute walk. The staff were friendly and helpful. We loved the hotel purely for its location. Would recommend this

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Area undergoing change”
Reviews.Author: mindelmouse
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 with 2 9 year old children. We stayed here one night pre cruise and one night post cruise. The hotel was very nice. The rooms were clean and rather large by Barcelona standards. We stayed in a family room which consisted of one bedroom with a queen size bed, a pull out couch (with a queen size bed)- which was all set up when we got into the room. There was a kitchenette, but no utensils or serviceware. However, I was told you could get it from the front desk. The front desk was friendly and quiet helpful. They gave up wake up calls, got us cars when needed and even recommended a great restaurant that was open for dinner on our "American" schedule. They also have free internet and computers to use in the lobby. The area is undergoing change. Right in front of the hotel it looks like a building was just knocked down and on the side streets graffiti abounds. However, our tour guide told us that some of the most expensive housing in the city is in this area, so I imagine it's undergoing a regentrification and should be beautiful when done. The price was fantastic and we were in walking distance of the metro, the beach and the olympic village. We would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice.”
Reviews.Author: satva
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the good reviews I read here. The rooms are very big. The only thing that I didnt like was the bad smell at the bathroom. The staff lady told me this is common at barcelona and I did smell the same thing at other places but I still found it stange and unplesant.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff with Barca's sights on the doorstep”
Reviews.Author: npr1uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights here before heading up to a camping holiday in Langeudoc in France. The staff we dealt with were all excellent. Friendly, spoke excellent English and able to pass on tips on where things were. The family room we stayed in was two rooms. A main bedroom and a diner/lounge with a double pull out bed. There was a fridge, which was stacked with a minibar, a tv with Spanish channels in both rooms, and a safe in the bedroom. The bathroom was like a wet room and a good size. Breakfast was included in the room rate we paid of 200 euros for a family of four for two nights. I've seen some reviews which said it wasn't worth it but it was a good spread with ereals, fruit, bread, ham and cheese along with some hot selections including fantasti little chorizo-style sausages. Secure underground parking is available for 16 euros for 24 hours. The nearest metro is about a five minute walk and then two stops to Las Ramlas. The tram stop is also nearby with restaurants and bars near the Olympic Port about 15 minutes away. And the open topped hop on hop bus stops about 10 minutes away. Some people have commented on the gravestone and memorial shops nearby. Yes you do have to walk past them to get to the metro and the hotel is not slap bang in the middle of the main tourist drag, but it feels safe and is very very lose to all the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, far exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Sandell_and_co
Reviews.Content: We thought this was a fantastic hotel. Originally we wanted a nice hotel for a decent price. After a lot of searching around for a place in Barcelona that fit our criteria, we came across this one. This hotel looked great from the photos but we were worried it wouldn't live up to its expectations...it did!! After a long trip we were happy to come to a clean, nice smelling hotel with lovely aircon. The hotel staff were very helpful at all hours of the day (and night), and we were surprised with the efficiency of the room service, and politeness of the waiters in the restaurant, who served us at 9.30. There was enough room in the rooms, the bathroom was lovely and everything was modern and worked as it should. The walls were nice and thick as well so we had a lot of privacy. We had access to the wifi whenever we wanted it. Our rooms were cleaned daily - the shower had a habit of flooding the floor, and the cleaners/maids gave us new towels and cleaned up the flood every day. Our beds were made, and our things were untouched, which I appreciated because I do not feel comfortable with people I don't know touching my belongings when I am not there. There could have been more plates, knives and forks, but all this took was a call to reception and this could be fixed. There were no coffees etc in the rooms, which we knew when we booked, but none of us drink coffee anyway so it was not a problem. Reception staff were very helpful, English-speaking, very patient and excellent at recommending places and giving directions. They were able to deal with anything and everything we threw at them (not literally) The doors were closed late at night, but we were able to get in without much of a problem. It was very easy to get to Las Ramblas, a few minutes walk from the hotel and then just two steps on the metro (the metros are amazing and leave very regularly, probably every two minutes, and only take five minutes to get to La Rambla). The upstairs sun-deck was lovely, very relaxing. On the day we left we were able to extend the room without much of a problem, for a small fee. I thought all the prices in the hotel were reasonable (room price, extending the room, menu)... The hotel quality was outstanding. I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “good,worth the money but need cleaner”
Reviews.Author: jollychippy
Reviews.Content: we went with 2 young children on july 2010 for 4 nights, as arrived at night so we take taxi to hotel and it takes about 15 mins & cost 23euro. We think its reasonable price. We stay at ground floor and did thinking to change to upper floor, but we actually like it the end of the trip because we found it easy to get on internet at night and buy drink & food. We didnt try the hotel breakfast cos seems not many selection and we walk to tube station junction and there few cafes and all serve different style local food. Its take 30 mins walk to Santigo so i suggest take the underground. Overall the location seems safe and okay to us, but the hotel mains will lock at midnight so have to ring the bell to get in... only no good enough is the room cleaning, cleaner only tidy up the bed n wont change the clean bedsheet, the mugs also not take out n change to us... .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with large clean rooms and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: JMJAEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Family room was excellent like a small apartment, very clean and modern. No cooking utensils in the kitchen but staff happy to lend you anything you needed from their kitchens. I wouldnt bother with breakfast there are supermarkets and a bakery close by. Free wi-fi in rooms good. Location is initially a bit off putting beside offices and a funeral parlour and not many restaurants close by but 2 mins to main metro line which only takes 4 mins to the Ramblas area and 15 mins walk to beach where there are lots of restaurants and there are a few good restaurants about 10 mins walk towards the beach. You can also walk to the park in 10 mins which is nice. Also short walk from bus station. Staff were very friendly and helpful.
